content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Mar 2019Is there a difference between net operating income and EBITDA? I keep seeing net operating income in real estate companies but not in other industries?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Yeo Enk LouiLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 24 Mar 2019Hey there!Operating income is the actual profit for a company’s operating activities. This is the amount of money a company makes from its core operations. EBITDA is a slight variation that metric used to show a company’s true profit from operations with respect to cash. It’s used gauge a company’s ability to service debt among other things.Esstentially, EBITDA is similar to net income with some factors of non-operating expenses added back into the value.0 comments1
